meanings.definition: Profits exceeding the normal or expected amount.
meanings.sent1: The company made superprofits this year by selling more products than usual.
meanings.sent2: The business owner was surprised by the superprofits earned during the holiday season.
meanings.sent3: The accountant joked that the superprofits were so high, they must have been a result of a lucky charm.
meanings.sent4: The superprofits were like a pot of gold at the end of a rainbow, bringing unexpected wealth.
meanings.sent5: The superprofits were like a treasure chest full of riches waiting to be discovered.

meanings.definition: Excessive profits beyond what is considered fair or reasonable.
meanings.sent1: The company faced criticism for making superprofits while other businesses struggled.
meanings.sent2: The government imposed regulations to prevent companies from earning superprofits at the expense of consumers.
meanings.sent3: The idea of superprofits seemed like a fairy tale in the competitive market.
meanings.sent4: The concept of superprofits was a double-edged sword, bringing wealth but also scrutiny.
meanings.sent5: The superprofits were a shining beacon of success in the business world.
